content.text:
# Warmund (archbishop of Vienne)

Warmund was the archbishop of Vienne from 1076 until his death in 1083.Bruno Galland, [https://doi.org/10.3406/befar.1994.1266 ''Deux archevêchés entre la France et l'Empire: les archevêques de Lyon et les archevêques de Vienne du milieu du XIIe au milieu du XIVe siècle''] (École française de Rome, 1994), p. 11, gives the dates of his episcopate as 1070–1082. As a monk of the abbey of Romans, he was elected to succeed Abbot  before the latter's death in 1070. He was later elected to succeed Léger as archbishop. He held the abbacy and archbishopric concurrently until his death. He is accused of dissipating the diocese's property. Upon his death, Bishop  administered the diocese as vicar. His successor, Guy of Burgundy, was only elected in 1088.
